intro: Wikstroemia souliei, commonly known as the Chinese sandarac tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, often glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value comes from its fragrant foliage and delicate floral displays.
